metric.name: Number of unassigned types
metric.systemDescription: Total number of types that are not assigned to any logical element defined in the architecture model.

metric.name: Number of violating references
metric.systemDescription: Total number of type references that start from types in the measured element and violate architectural restrictions.

metric.name: Number of violating type dependencies
metric.systemDescription: Total number of type dependencies that start from types in the measured element and violate architectural restrictions. Ignored violations are not counted.

metric.name: Number of violating types
metric.systemDescription: Total number of types with a dependency violation according to the systems architecture model.

metric.name: Structural debt (index)
metric.systemDescription:
This metric computes a number that should be roughly proportional to the effort needed to clean up structural quality problems in your code. It is computed on build unit level and then aggregated to project and system level. Basically the following major components go into the computation of the metric:
- The number of type dependencies that would need to be cut to break all cyclic package dependencies: 10 metric points per type dependency and 1 additional point per occurrence of the dependency in the code (preferring dependencies that are also architecture violations). - Architecture violations: Again 10 metric points per forbidden type dependency and 1 point per occurrence in the code (already cut cyclic architecture violating dependencies are not counted again). - Refactoring tasks: 1 point for each move, delete and rename refactoring task, 10 points per cut dependency refactoring task. For delete and cut refactoring tasks 1 additional point per occurrence in the code.
Although this metric is certainly not perfect it is a good indicator for the level of structural erosion in a project. The higher the value the more effort will be needed to clean up the project. You will also see that the metric will grow in times of high pressure and that it will shrink when you invest time into improving the structure of the code.

metric.name: Structural erosion (reference level)
metric.systemDescription: Number of code references that must be removed in order to remove all package cycles in a project (this is not always the exact minimum number, but a heuristic-based guess).

metric.name: Structural erosion (type level)
metric.systemDescription: Number of type dependencies that must be cut in order to remove all package cycles in a project (this is not always the exact minimum number, but a heuristic-based guess).

metric.name: Number of cyclic packages
metric.systemDescription: Total number of cyclically coupled packages contained in a project.

metric.name: Number of type dependencies (all)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of all type dependencies (in and out) of types contained in the measured element; including dependencies to external types.

metric.name: Average component dependency (ACD)
metric.systemDescription: Average number of components (source files) a component (source file) depends on directly and indirectly. This metric can be used to characterize the overall average coupling of project internal components (source files).

metric.name: Normalized cumulative component dependency (NCCD)
metric.systemDescription: The ratio between the cumulative component dependency of a project and the cumulative component dependency of a balanced binary tree of the same size. A value greater than 1 indicates a more vertical design. A value less than 1 indicates a more horizontal design.

metric.name: Number of Java source files
metric.systemDescription: Total number of Java source files contained in the measured element.

metric.name: Number of build units
metric.systemDescription: Total number of build units aggregated for the measured element.

metric.name: Number of instructions
metric.systemDescription: Total number of byte code instructions of a class file aggregated for the measured element.

metric.name: Number of internal packages
metric.systemDescription: Total number of internal packages contained in the measured element.

metric.name: Number of internal types (all)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of internal types contained in the measured element.

metric.name: Number of fix warning tasks
metric.systemDescription: Total number of warnings which are related to the measured element and have been converted to fix warning tasks.

metric.name: Number of ignored violations
metric.systemDescription: Total number of violations which are related to the measured element and filtered out by a violation filter.

metric.name: Number of ignored warnings
metric.systemDescription: Total number of warnings which are related to the measured element and filtered out by an ignore warning filter.

metric.name: Number of refactoring tasks
metric.systemDescription: Total number of refactoring tasks defined in the measured element.

metric.name: Number of tasks
metric.systemDescription: Total number of tasks defined in the measured element.

metric.name: Number of warnings (all)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of warnings which are related to the measured element. All kinds of warnings are counted.

metric.name: Number of warnings (cyclic)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of cycle group warnings which are related to the measured element.

metric.name: Number of warnings (duplicate code blocks)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of duplicate code block warnings which are related to the measured element.

metric.name: Number of warnings (thresholds)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of threshold warnings which are related to the measured element.

metric.name: Number of warnings (workspace)
metric.systemDescription: Total number of workspace warnings which are related to the measured element.
